DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Vial Tissue Collection Submission Average Volume Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the average volume, in milliliters, of a vial or collection tube containing a bit of tissue or blood or urine being submitted to a repository or tissue bank.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a vial or collection tube containing a bit of tissue or blood or urine being submitted or placed into a repository or tissue bank.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding medicines and chemicals.:A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.:Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids.
A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the average volume of a specimen in milliliters.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The central tendency of a set of n numbers; lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
